DOC.brief_title: Change Peripheral Oxygen Saturation Using Different Breathing Procedures High Altitude
DOC.detailed_description: Acute mountain sickness ( AMS ) pathological effect high altitude human cause acute exposure low partial pressure oxygen high altitude . It commonly occur 2500 meter altitude . AMS appear collection nonspecific symptom acquire high altitude low air pressure resemble case `` flu , carbon monoxide poisoning , hangover '' . It cause drop pressure lower partial pressure oxygen increase altitude . The direct consequence change hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction ( Euler-Lijestrand-mechanism ) . In addition rise pulmonary blood pressure ( Hypertonia ) occur high risk develop high altitude pulmonary edema ( HAPE ) . In investigation investigator explore whether different type breathe procedure improve peripheral oxygen saturation . We compare breathe regulation two different procedure hyperventilation trek different altitude . Procedure 1 ( hyperventilation 1 ) describe inhalation one step exhalation next step . Procedure 2 ( hyperventilation 2 ) describe inhalation exhalation one step . The effect different breathing procedure quantify measure peripheral oxygen saturation . In addition investigator compare breathe rate minute ventilation well expiratory end-tidal CO2-partial pressure three different breathe procedure .
